plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant native to North America, known for its large, bright yellow flower heads that follow the sun's movement throughout the day. Sunflowers are widely cultivated for ornamental use, seeds, and oil production.
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism, turning their flower heads to track the sun during the day.

plants.name: Lobelia siphilitica
plants.description: A herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America, known for its striking spikes of deep blue flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
plants.funFact: Historically, some Native American tribes used Great Blue Lobelia medicinally to treat respiratory ailments.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub prized for its large, vivid flowers. It blooms year-round in tropical climates and is widely grown as an ornamental plant in gardens worldwide.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical regions, peaks in summer
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers are edible and often used in herbal teas and beverages known as hibiscus tea.

plants.name: Alstroemeria aurea
plants.description: A perennial plant native to South America, producing clusters of colorful, tiger-striped flowers. Commonly used in floral arrangements due to their long vase life.
plants.location: Chile, Argentina, cultivated in temperate gardens
plants.funFact: Alstroemeria petals can have reversible leaves, a unique feature not common in most flowers.
